trigger: The transcriptionally active factors mediating the effect of the HTLV-I <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transactivator on the <extra_id_0> IL-2R alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> kappa B enhancer include the product of the <extra_id_0> c-rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proto-oncogene .

The transactivator HTLV-I <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activates the promoter of the gene coding for the <extra_id_0> interleukin 2 alpha-chain receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-2R alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) via a kappa B site that can bind several protein species of the rel family .
<extra_id_0> Tax1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> strongly activates the enhancer activity of this motif , in both epithelial HeLa and lymphoid Jurkat cells .
This activation was not observed in undifferentiated embryocarcinoma F9 cells .

Overexpression of the <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and Rel proteins in these cells showed that significant activation of the <extra_id_0> IL-2R alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> kappa B site was observed only with Rel and Rel plus <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Moreover , whereas both <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ( PMA ) are able to efficiently induce the binding of NF-kappa B to the <extra_id_0> IL-2R alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> kappa B site , PMA is functionally inactive .
Using the DNA affinity precipitation assay , we observed that <extra_id_0> Tax1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is able to efficiently induce the binding of Rel , whereas PMA is not .
This established a clear difference between both stimuli , indicating that Rel is the functionally active factor .

We conclude from these results that the functional activity of members of the rel family is regulated by their interaction with DNA and that Rel can be a potent transcriptional activator on specific kappa B sites .
